## American Rescue Plan Act of 2021

```{r}
#split handles up to 46 groups of 4 handles to keep under the 128 character limit for each query
# so will be 46 queries
for(i in 1:46){
  start_num <- (i - 1) * 4 + 1
  end_num <- start_num + 3
  handles_slice <- handles[start_num:end_num]
  query[i] <- paste0('from:', handles_slice, collapse = ' OR ')
}

american_rescue_2021_list <- rep(list(NA), 46)

# the below query is ready to try, review first
for(i in 1:2){
  american_rescue_2021_list[i] <- search_fullarchive(
    query[i],
    n = 1000,
    env_name="develop",
    fromDate = "202102200000",
    toDate = "202103052359",
    parse = FALSE
  )
}

search_fullarchive(
    "from:PattyMurray",
    env_name="develop",
    fromDate = "202102200000",
    toDate = "202103052359",
    parse = FALSE
)

search_fullarchive(
    "fire",
    env_name="develop",
    parse = FALSE
)
  
american_rescue_2021_b <- search_fullarchive(query, env_name="develop", fromDate = "202102200000", toDate = "202103052359", parse = FALSE)
```

```{r}
american_rescue_2021 <- get_timeline(
  user=handles,
  since_id = c("1495486916082425857"),
  max_id = c("1500957088738160643")
)

american_rescue_2021_users <- users_data(american_rescue_2021)
```

```{r}
# remove columns that are lists because they will cause errors
american_rescue_2021_selected <- american_rescue_2021 %>%
  select(-c(geo, coordinates, entities, place, possibly_sensitive, retweeted_status, quoted_status, quoted_status_permalink, withheld_in_countries))

write.csv(american_rescue_2021_selected, "data/raw_tweets/american_rescue_2021.csv", row.names = FALSE)

american_rescue_2021_users_selected <- american_rescue_2021_users %>%
  select(-c(derived, withheld_in_countries, entities))

write.csv(american_rescue_2021_users_selected, "data/raw_tweets/american_rescue_2021_users.csv", row.names = FALSE)
```
